intro: Impatiens corchorifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in humid climates. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by insects, contributing to its ecological role in supporting local pollinator populations.
